Phrynoderma (a form of follicular hyperkeratosis due to vitamin A deficiency)

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.reasoning: Presents with hyperglycemia, and can have associated episodes of weakness due to fluctuating blood sugar levels.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Sinusitis
diagnoses.reasoning: Ongoing sinutitis could be a manifestation of chronic sinusitis, which may also affect overall weakness and fatigue levels.

diagnoses.name: Pneumonia
diagnoses.reasoning: Directly mentioned as a symptom, pneumonia can lead to systemic symptoms such as weakness.

diagnoses.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
diagnoses.reasoning: While not directly indicated, PCOS can be associated with endometriosis, hyperglycemia (through insulin resistance), and can have systemic effects that might explain some of the symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Thyroid Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Can cause a wide range of symptoms including episodic weakness (particularly in hypothyroidism) and could be indirectly related to menstrual irregularities and metabolic disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Adrenal Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Adrenal insufficiency can cause hyperglycemia, weakness, and also has connections to immune system dysregulation which could tie into chronic infections or autoimmune processes.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.reasoning: An autoimmune disease that can cause widespread symptoms, including potential endometriosis, hyperglycemia due to medication (steroids), and susceptibility to infections like pneumonia.

diagnoses.name: Immunodeficiency Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Could explain recurrent sinutitis and pneumonia due to a diminished ability to fight infections.

diagnoses.name: Cystic Fibrosis
diagnoses.reasoning: While more commonly diagnosed in childhood, cystic fibrosis can present with recurrent sinutitis, diabetes (hence, hyperglycemia), and complications that include pneumonia.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.reasoning: A neurological condition that can manifest as episodic weakness, and while less directly related to the other symptoms, could potentially explain a broad array of symptoms due to nervous system involvement.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP)
diagnoses.description: An immune disorder characterized by the destruction of platelets, leading to easy bruising, bleeding, and potentially contributing to symptoms like lymphadenitis due to immune dysregulation.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body, including the skin, joints, kidneys, heart, lungs, brain, and blood cells. Symptoms can include lymphadenitis, easy bruising, and eye irritation.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that provide lubrication to the eyes and mouth. It can accompany other immune system disorders, such as rheumatoid arthritis and lupus, possibly explaining the constellation of symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Leukemia
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow that can cause basophilia, easy bruising due to low platelet counts, lymphadenitis, and eye irritation due to infiltration or immunological responses.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: The virus and the syndrome can cause a wide range of immune symptoms, including lymphadenitis, and through immune suppression, increase susceptibility to infections that may cause eye irritation and easy bruising.

diagnoses.name: Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder that causes blood vessel inflammation throughout the body, including the eyes, possibly leading to symptoms like irritated eyes and other systemic issues.

diagnoses.name: Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which can cause lymphadenitis, and due to its effects on the immune system, can lead to symptoms like easy bruising.

diagnoses.name: Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: Similar to Hodgkin's lymphoma, this affects the body's lymphatic system but presents with different markers. It can lead to lymphadenitis, easy bruising, and nonspecific symptoms like eye irritation.

diagnoses.name: Mixed Connective Tissue Disease (MCTD)
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that may combine features of lupus, scleroderma, and polymyositis, among others, and could explain a wide range of symptoms including vulvodynia, basophilia, and easy bruising.

diagnoses.name: Vasculitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the blood vessels that can cause a wide range of symptoms depending on which organs are affected, potentially including easy bruising, lymphadenitis, and eye irritation.

diagnoses.name: Cushing's Syndrome
diagnoses.reasoning: Presents with striae, weight loss due to muscle wasting, and can have immunosuppression leading to infections such as vaginitis.

diagnoses.name: Autoimmune Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Symptoms like angioedema and sinutitis could indicate an underlying autoimmune process, potentially affecting multiple systems.

diagnoses.name: Anorexia Nervosa
diagnoses.reasoning: Weight loss and striae from rapid weight changes can be associated. Secondary immune deficiency could lead to infections like vaginitis.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.reasoning: Weight loss and increased susceptibility to opportunistic infections, including vaginitis, could be signs, along with various dermatological manifestations like angioedema.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Sinusitis
diagnoses.reasoning: Directly accounts for sinusitis, and chronic inflammation could be linked to weight loss. Immunosuppression or antibiotic use could lead to vaginitis.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.reasoning: Directly causes angioedema. Chronic disease states can influence weight and secondary effects could indirectly relate to other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Addison's Disease
diagnoses.reasoning: Presents with weight loss, and hyperpigmentation can be mistaken for striae. Immune system alterations may increase risk of infections.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.reasoning: Uncontrolled diabetes can lead to weight loss and increased risk of infections including vaginitis. Though less directly connected, it can be linked with increased angioedema and sinusitis incidences.

diagnoses.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
diagnoses.reasoning: Can present with weight loss or gain, and is directly linked to increased risk of vaginitis. Striae might occur due to rapid changes in weight.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.reasoning: Can cause weight changes, and myxedema could be mistaken for angioedema. Atypical symptoms could sometimes include an impact on mucus membranes leading to sinusitis.

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests
diagnoses: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (considering dyspnea, despite normal PFTs)
Heart Failure (considering dyspnea, despite normal PFTs)

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: HIV/AIDS can lead to a weakened immune system, making the body more susceptible to infections like sinusitis, and can also cause leukoplakia. Anxiety and fever (hyperthermia) can also be symptoms associated with the infection or its treatment.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL)
diagnoses.description: CLL can lead to increased susceptibility to infection due to a compromised immune system. Leukoplakia could be a related symptom. CLL can also indirectly cause anxiety and fever.

diagnoses.name: Sjogren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that make moisture, such as salivary and tear ducts, could result in oral health issues like leukoplakia and increased vulnerability to sinus infections. Fever and anxiety can be symptomatic of the disease or its complications.

diagnoses.name: Lupus
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body, including the skin, joints, and/or organs inside the body. It can cause leukoplakia, make the body more prone to infections, and can be associated with fevers and anxiety due to the stress of living with a chronic condition.

diagnoses.name: Behcet's Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that results in inflammation of the blood vessels. This condition can lead to mouth sores similar to leukoplakia, increased susceptibility to infections, fever, and anxiety due to its chronic and painful nature.

diagnoses.name: Lichen Planus
diagnoses.description: A condition that forms lacy white patches, sometimes with painful sores, on the mucous membranes of the mouth - potentially leukoplakia. Can lead to emotional distress or anxiety, does not directly cause increased susceptibility to infections but can cause discomfort and systemic symptoms like fever.

diagnoses.name: Immune Deficiency Disorders
diagnoses.description: These disorders weaken the immune system, making the body more susceptible to infections such as sinusitis. Patients may develop lesions in their mouth similar to leukoplakia. They might experience fever due to frequent infections and anxiety due to the chronic nature of their condition.

diagnoses.name: Crohn's Disease
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory bowel disease that can cause leukoplakia-like lesions in the mouth and increase the risk of sinusitis through nutrient malabsorption leading to a weak immune system. Patients may experience fever during flare-ups and anxiety due to the chronic nature of the disease.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.description: Poorly controlled diabetes can lead to a higher susceptibility to infections like sinusitis, possibly leukoplakia due to a compromised immune response, fever as a response to infection, and anxiety associated with managing a chronic condition.

diagnoses.name: Stress-Related Disorders
diagnoses.description: While typically not direct causes of physical symptoms, stress-related disorders can exacerbate or coincide with other conditions, leading to increased susceptibility to infections, possibly indirect effects on oral health leading to leukoplakia-like symptoms, fever, and certainly anxiety.

diagnoses: Asthma exacerbation (if associated with respiratory symptoms)
Anisakiasis (from consuming raw or undercooked fish)
Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, Ulcerative colitis)
Chemical exposure (e.g., to irritants or toxins)
Viral infection (e.g., norovirus causing gastrointestinal symptoms plus a separate allergic reaction)
Inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., Crohn's disease, Ulcerative colitis)

diagnoses.name: Migraine
diagnoses.details: Migraine headaches can cause severe head pain, nausea, sensitivity to light and sound, and sometimes numbness or weakness.

diagnoses.name: Stroke
diagnoses.details: A stroke occurs when blood flow to an area of the brain is cut off, causing brain cells to die. Symptoms can include sudden numbness, weakness, especially on one side of the body, confusion, trouble speaking, and severe headache.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.details: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a disease of the central nervous system that can lead to numbness, weakness, and often headache.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.details: Uncontrolled diabetes can lead to diabetic neuropathy, where high blood sugar damages nerves, causing numbness and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Tension Headaches
diagnoses.details: Tension headaches, the most common type of headache, can cause mild to moderate pain, sometimes accompanied by numbness and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Brain Tumor
diagnoses.details: A brain tumor can press on nerve cells in the brain, causing symptoms like headache, numbness, and weakness in parts of the body.

diagnoses.name: Anemia
diagnoses.details: Severe or chronic anemia can reduce oxygen delivery to the brain and other organs, leading to headache, weakness, and sometimes numbness.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.details: Hypothyroidism can lead to a slow metabolism, which might cause tiredness, weakness, and possibly an increase in headaches.

diagnoses.name: Hypertension
diagnoses.details: High blood pressure can lead to headache and, if extremely high or left untreated, could cause damage leading to numbness and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.details: In some cases, Lyme disease can affect the nervous system, causing symptoms like headache, facial palsy (which can include numbness), and weakness of limbs.

diagnoses: Brain tumor affecting auditory and neural pathways

diagnoses.name: Migraine
diagnoses.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense headaches often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound. In some cases, migraines are preceded by sensory disturbances called auras, which can include symptoms like scotoma and parasthesia.

diagnoses.name: Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA)
diagnoses.description: Often labeled as a 'mini-stroke,' a TIA is a temporary period of symptoms similar to those of a stroke. It can cause sudden headache, dizziness, and numbness or weakness in the face, arms, or legs, often on one side of the body. Visual disturbances such as scotomas can also occur.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
diagnoses.description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves. Symptoms vary widely but can include fatigue, difficulty walking, numbness or weakness on one or both sides of the body, and visual disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Optic Neuritis
diagnoses.description: Inflammation of the optic nerve that can cause a sudden decrease in vision along with a headache and scotoma. It's often associated with multiple sclerosis.

diagnoses.name: Brain Tumor
diagnoses.description: A mass or growth of abnormal cells in the brain. Symptoms can include headaches that may be more severe in the morning, changes in vision such as scotomas, numbness or tingling in the limbs, and other neurological problems.

diagnoses.name: Stroke
diagnoses.description: Occurs when the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced, preventing brain tissue from getting oxygen and nutrients. Symptoms can include headache, trouble speaking, paralysis or numbness of the face, arm or leg, and vision problems.

diagnoses.name: Anemia
diagnoses.description: A condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues. It can cause fatigue, weakness, and in severe cases, neurological complications like headaches and numbness.

diagnoses.name: Hypertension
diagnoses.description: High blood pressure, a common condition in which the long-term force of the blood against your artery walls is high enough that it may eventually cause health conditions, such as heart disease. Symptoms can include severe headache, fatigue, and vision problems.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes
diagnoses.description: A group of diseases that result in too much sugar in the blood. Diabetes can cause a wide range of symptoms including neuropathy (nerve damage) leading to parasthesia, as well as vision problems and other health complications.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: An infectious disease caused by the Borrelia bacterium which is spread by ticks. Early symptoms can include headache, fatigue, and skin rash. If left untreated, it may lead to neurological problems like facial palsy, neuropathy, and meningitis.

diagnoses: Bone Marrow Failure Syndromes (e.g., Aplastic Anemia)
DRESS Syndrome (Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms)
